moves.1... d5 2. Bf4 e6: So, I don't have to worry about the bishop coming to f5, I continue with developing the knight
moves.3. Nf3 Nf6 4. e3 c6 5. c3 Nbd7 6. Nbd2 B: White has several options here, but opt for safety first
moves.9. O-O Bb7 10. Ne5 c5 11. Ndf3 c4: Black relieves the tension in the centre and moves the bishop away from attacking the h7 square
moves.12. Be2 b5 13. a3 a5 14. b3 Ne4 15. Nxd7: The knight on e5 is a real bonus for white
moves.17... Qd5 18. f3: Now White uses pawns to force balck back
moves.21. Rxb5 Nxf4 22. Rxb7 Nxe2+ 23. Qxe2 Bx: White consolidates control of the open file
moves.24... Bd6 25. Rd7: Ouch, balck blunders apiece and resigns
